intro: Bartlettina hemisphaerica, commonly known as the spherical thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant is characterized by its spherical, spiny fruit heads that resemble a miniature globe, which is a unique adaptation for seed dispersal. Its leaves are typically covered in fine hairs and have a somewhat succulent texture. Bartlettina hemisphaerica is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological niche.
